content:
Hi all,
We have created valuesets using cpt code system but while publishing using R4 publisher we are getting this error
valueset-error.PNG
Could anyone suggest in resolving this issue??
Thanks in advance.
there is no resolution to the issue - CPT is not supported for licensing reasons

How about if you get this same error when trying to resolve a CodeSystem that is included in the IG? any tips on that?
(its currently a private IG)
Worked it out, the codesystem was marked as fragment, when it was actually complete.

So the CPT licencing thing - is this an error we can publish an IG with? "The value provided (http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt::44970) is not in the options value set in the questionnaire" (I mean an error we are allowed to ignore?)

I am using http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/cpt-all as the value set.
but it's not clear to me that you can publish an IG that includes that code at all
Hmmmm, it's the HAI IG and the only allowable code is a CPT code... (It's required). So the example really has to have it. Not sure how to get around including a CPT code.
need to check that with Wayne. I believe that at the moment we do not have a license that allows us to publish that
Interesting. We also have it in the corresponding CDA IG. I guess we could put "fake-CPT-code" in (it would throw same error).
it would be much better to put a real CPT code in there.
I thought I saw somewhere that you could do it you just had to include a specific copyright
It def would be better to put a real code in!

It's here: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/cpt.html
Says: When Value Sets include CPT codes, the copyright element should include the text "CPT copyright 2014 American Medical Association. All rights reserved.".
